othermeta.name: shortdesc
othermeta.content: Actions on agreements and programs (such as Amend, Activate, Create From, Complete) are available in the UI once records reach appropriate states.

othermeta.name: usecase
othermeta.content: describe UI actions and lifecycle transitions available for agreements and programs

body.p: Actions are available on Agreements once they are amended which extends to Programs. For example, when an agreement is amended, you can click the Amend button to edit the agreement. When the agreement is In Amendment, action buttons become available to program analysts so they can quickly extend some of these actions to one or more programs.

The agreement is versioned when it is amended. However, individual programs are not versioned until one of the available actions is performed. For example, the Analyst may want to add a New Program to the agreement. They can click the New Program button, create a new program, and save it. The new program is added to the agreement in a Draft status; the programs already associated to the agreement are in Activated status. When the agreement is re-activated, the agreement and new program status are set to Activated. Analysts view the new program and older unaffected programs associated to the latest, now Activated Agreement.
